woman.name: Alice Ball
woman.fact: First female chemistry professor. At just 23 years old, Ball developed a groundbreaking treatment for leprosy

woman.name: Rosalind Franklin
woman.fact: Franklin's research data was the first to demonstrate the basic dimensions of DNA strands and reveal the molecule was in two matching parts, running in opposite directions.

woman.name: Dorothy Hodgkin
woman.field: chemist on the cutting edge of X-ray crystallography
woman.fact: Throughout her career, she made numerous breakthrough discoveries, including the atomic structure of penicillin, the structure of vitamin B12 and the structure of insulin.

woman.name: Grace Hopper
woman.fact: She became the first person to call computer problems 'bugs' in the system.
